item.title: Bolivia Is Fed Up with Socialism
item.description: Both presidential candidates who advanced to the runoff promise to undo two decades of leftism.

item.title: Putin’s ‘Peace’ Proposal Would Be a Prelude to More War
item.description: The Russian president is demanding a steep price for peace — on terms so favorable for Moscow that it would likely be a temporary reprieve.

item.title: Canada’s Assisted Suicide Regime Is the West’s Cry for Help
item.description: Even mainstream secular outlets are noticing the horrors and abuse of legalized euthanasia.

item.title: The Persecution of the Little Sisters of the Poor
item.description: The relentless litigation targeting a Catholic order of nuns is deeply alarming.

item.title: Using Tax Incentives to Improve Our Economic Statistics
item.description: Higher participation rates, as well as more timely and accurate responses, are necessary to improve the performance of our economic surveys.
